results.content:
Crumbs! Only halfway?
I have just finished lesson 67. Creating Movies and I have to admit that things are getting a bit tricky now.
That is good thing! Things are being covered that will be needed in a real website.
I will certainly need to do a lot more research before I even begin to understand everything up to this point but at least I now know what I need to know.

Other courses that have come across have just scratched the surface and serve only as a very basic introduction.
In my opinion, most are utterly useless and only really cover things that could easily be found on YouTube or the Blazor home pages.

So far, I am very happy that I bought this course and feel a lot more confident that I will eventually be able to create my own Blazor websites.

OK - I have finished the course now. I must say that, I have to agree with some others that it was far to fast in places. Very few can concentrate that hard. After a while the voice just faded into the background and I started daydreaming. This could have been an absolutely brilliant course if the pace was slowed right down. I was slightly disappointed that the promised last course was not available but that's life.  On the whole I was pleased by the course.  OK that's all I have to say.

results.content:
Good course, overall I quite like the pace and the amount of detail.  

Two things:

1. Why bother with injecting the occasional extra bit of info on how to do things in VS Code and/or CLI, aka non-Visual Studio/PC?  I work during the day on PC/Win10 in Visual Studio (enterprise) and prefer doing my personal projects on Mac in VS Code. There wasn't enough details on how to do things on vs code or even cli, so I would just remove all that stuff since it's basically up to us to figure out/get things running properly on non-windows platforms.  As such I have the app sorta working in SQL (running on linux/docker container) but can't add any new records (but can login with the one account created by the migrations with your hotmail). I'm not getting any errors either so I'm a bit surprised I can login but can't add register a new user (but can add/remove genres and movies, etc). Anyway just seems like a pretty significant hole in the course since dotnet core is cross-platform and a lot of people that don't have access to PC and/or visual studio. Nobody uses Visual Studio on Mac (since it's not identical to pc VS), everyone uses VS Code.

2. I'm not sure ending on Blazer Server is a great idea. I'm actually a bit confused right now and while I *think* I know why I would use one approach over another it would be nice to have a finally summary with pros/cons of the different Blazor approaches. I think that would help the course feel like it's been completed. I think this is the only part of Blazor I don't 100% love and get, aka why there is 3 (?) different approaches; seems to just muddy the waters of attracting new developers.

I'm very impressed with this course. He shows you the simple way to do something, but then shows you the better way to do it to make your code more useful in the future.

On the other hand, as I continue with the course, he accelerates and doesn't explain things in detail. I end up just copying his text quickly without really knowing what I am doing. (Some concepts are still new to me so I get confused.) I guess if you take the time to pause the video and research what he means by things or why he is doing something you can learn a lot more. But I feel like he left me as a beginner in Module 3 or 4 and jumped to intermediate level.

I cranked it to 1.25 speed and found it comfortable to follow.

results.content:
TL:DR
Content fantastic. Video at points far to fast.


The negative part  of this course and the reason its not 5 Stars from me.

As others have said the video is far to fast. Some sections literally flash on the screen and are gone. Yes you can pause, yes you can rewind, but it is a pain.

The positives
Its clear that Felipe clearly knows what he is talking about.
This course unlike others covers techniques that you will use in real world applications.

I'm about 60% through the course at the moment, and I'm covering things that while useful, I'm certainly going to have to do my own investigation to understand them as Felipe doesn't go into to much depth about things. (But that is the point of this course) What he does do is tell you how to use them so this project will become a fantastic reference tool.

results.content:
Ein wirklich, wirklich toller Einstieg in Blazor (auch .NET 5 geeignet!), welcher bei nahezu 0 anfängt und sukzessive Wissen aufbaut. Besonders hervorzuheben ist, dass es wirklich sehr viele Aspekte der Entwicklung aufgreift, Lösungswege bereitstellt und sauberen Code ermöglicht. 
Ja, der Akzent ist am Anfang schwierig zu verstehen und ja, die Geschwindigkeit ist teilweise echt schnell. Aber dafür gibt es auch die Rückspul-Möglichkeit im Video. So what? ;)
Der Kurs ist definitiv besser als zunächst von den anderen Bewertungen zu erwarten. Kudos!

results.content:
Felipe, is covering a lot of grounds in this course. He is going step-by-step to show all powerful features of Blazor.
Another thing that I like about this instructor, he just doesn't cover one basic way of doing something just to cover it, he shows different alternatives and combinations of real life.
Also, there are lots of materials that he covers, that are NOT in MSFT Docs. He literally experimented these features and brought it to us. Now I can appreciate how powerful Blazor is, for such a young age.
This makes the course very useful.

I highly recommend this course as a beginner & intermediate course.

results.content:
Concise and Precise.

I was able to rewrite a VB6 application from the ground up to Blazor with just a few hours of this course, integrating some tools and technology such as AutoMapper and MediatR in a Verticle Slice Architecture. 

This course is also a good reference for experienced developers.

results.content: Felipe has has exceeded my expectations.  I have done a few Blazor courses and this was by far the best.  Explained the content very well.  Some folks might think it goes a bit fast, but the pacing was fine.  You can always pause those sections where you need more time.  The conversion to IdentityServer4 is a great addition to the course.
